Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: Lee W
Reviews.Content: I don't see why people would rate this property very negatively, the price for their room was 50 bucks, what do you want in 50? A diamond shredded mattress? Frankly I was not upset with the stay yes room did need a bit of cleaning, and the hotel staff needs to use more air freshner to at least keep the cigarette smell down if not eliminate. If I had showed up with my family I would probably not stay here but for one night visit, it was okay!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible motel”
Reviews.Author: indy2012
Reviews.Content: We check-in in this motel at New Years Eve to attend a formal dinner dance show, the room smell is terrible bad, gum sticked on top of the headboard, bed sheet with blood spot and some yellow stain near the pillow, a small coffee pot and no coffee cups, behind the dresser at least 3 cigarette butts and the worst disguisting was the used condom! I report these to the desk and definitely want to change the room, it tooks an hour for the desk came up and we showed him the evidences. (I did have a picture to proof it too). We are senior from out of town, requesting ground floor non-smoking room is more convenience for us, but she put us on the 3rd floor, the business is not busy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Hey, It's $50. You should know what to expect.”
Reviews.Author: samuraicowboy
Reviews.Content: Carpets that any self-respecting homeowner would be ashamed to live with or let friends see, remnants of old cigarette burns at the edge of most flat surfaces, lingering cigarette smell in a "non-smoking" room, dust on all areas that are not immediately accessible by vacuum cleaner or damp rag. But no worse than any other older $50 per night hotel of its kind.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: chell112
Reviews.Content: The price was right. The rooms were comfortable. The WiFi signal wasn't so good in the back of the hotel, it may have been better in another room. The hotel needs minor repairs all around to be really nice, but it was clean and comfortable. Numerous dining places, a 24 hr pharmacy, and Wal-Mart all within a very short distance.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: FlickTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrible, and I can handle bad hotels. Bathroom toilet didn't flush, heat wasn't on in our room and took forever to warm up and then we were sweating all night, continental breakfast didn't begin early in the morning so we missed it, had to go outside to go to the lobby. Just horrible. Old hotel, rundown, not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “wow!”
Reviews.Author: yeayason
Reviews.Content: what! only four towels a day! that's insane. I use two towels a day and there was four of us in the room. Confounded i must say!

Reviews.Title: “OK budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjctraveler
Reviews.Content: Checkin was pretty quick, about 5 minutes. This is an older hotel that used to be a Fairfield Inn by Marriott. My room door (339) was very hard to open, they must have re-carpeted without trimming the bottom of the door. The room was small, the bathroom is very small. The window seals are failing so many of the windows are fogged up. The internet worked great. Breakfast was basic, there were waffles you make yourself, but no bread for toast. The AC did not cycle so I woke up at 2am and my room was 62 degrees! It is an OK budget motel. Good price (about $50), good location with easy access to office park and I-465. Bed was firm, but bedding was older and the fitted sheets wouldn’t stay on the bed. The outdoor pool was cold so I didn’t go swimming. The hotel is far enough away from Michigan Avenue and I-465 that noise is not a problem. The Holiday Inn across the street has a large water park that must allow the general public (for a fee) and customers park all over Wesleyan and Depauw Blvd creating congestion. Restaurants are all over this part of town. I would stay here again, but the Indianapolis tax of 17% is too high for me.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, good value”
Reviews.Author: dany_nyc
Reviews.Content: Super 8 College Park has spacious, clean, comfortable rooms. The staff and management are friendly and helpful. The wireless internet is fast and works well. I didn't try the breakfast buffet but it looked good. They even have a swimming pool. You can't beat the value. I will stay again when I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Going Down Hill”
Reviews.Author: SunLuvr321
Reviews.Content: Every year we go to Indiannapolis for the Indy 500, and have been staying at this hotel for the past 5 years. It started as a Fairfield Inn, and then switched to a Super 8. Since it became a Super 8 it has steadily gotten worse, and this year is enough to send us looking for a new hotel for next Memorial Day. When we walked into our room, we noticed that it smelled off. I would say that it reminded me of a place that has a dog with long hair and it smells like pet and burnt hair after vacuuming. The floor of the shower was dirty looking. The first night we noticed one of the pillows was completely ripped down one side. We left it out of the case for the maid to switch it out. When we got back, the pillow was back in the case, with the ripped side pointing in instead of out. And the floor felt like there were spots missing under the carpet, walking around the room would be a series of us and downs. The sheet kept coming off the bed, and everything just felt plain dirty. I wanted to walk around with my socks on the floor. I think it started out poorly when we checked in, we gave the last name, and nothing was verified. We switched from one credit card to another, and the man at the desk never asked for a signature or anything, even though the names on the reservation and the credit card were completely different. I could have checked in with anyone's credit card, and no one would have known. On the plus side, there is a nice beautiful flat screen HD TV in the lobby. I guess money is going into fixing up the lobby, but not the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great for price”
Reviews.Author: mphrpm
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by the owner when we checked in, she was friendly and helpful. She also gave us the fax number so we could get our airline information faxed to us. We were given a room on the first floor which we requested at check in. Room was comfortable and clean, Refrigerator was also clean. Breakfast was good, and the staff working the morning shift were helpful and pleasant. They were willing to assist as needed. Would stay again. Pets allowed with deposit. Plenty of parking, close to attractions and restaurants and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Location, price, and appearance are right but there are a few problems”
Reviews.Author: vanbibj
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great safe location w/ nearby restaurants and quick access to I-465. Plenty of parking and exterior appearance was decent with very nice abundant flowers in front of the lobby area. Check-in(arrived at 3:15 p.m.) went smoothly and the male attendant was friendly. I was assigned a 2nd floor room 222 which had a king bed(although I believe it was closer to a queen size). I was surprised at just how comfortable the bed was to sleep in, although you should definitely bring your own pillow(s). The bottom sheet was a flat sheet instead of a fitted sheet like a previous reviewer mentioned so by morning time I was laying on a bare mattress. The restroom/shower room area is a little cramped for space but it did the trick. The drain in the shower was apparently partially clogged though so I was standing in ankle high water by the time I finished my shower. The only other problem is that if you are on the 2nd floor, it is difficult to use your room key card to call the elevator up to the 2nd floor. I had to try on average about six times with my key card before I was successful in calling up the elevator. The FREE continental breakfast was nice and it ran from I think 6 a.m. to 9 a.m.. I got down there at 8:00 a.m. and there was still plenty of food(waffle maker, cereal, milk, banana). If you're looking to save some money(paid $59 w/ tax for one night) on a short stay and don't mind a few minor problems it's an okay place.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ugobananas
Reviews.Content: We'll start with when we first walked in to the hotel: We were greeted by signs posted on the front desk stating a huge list of strict rules regarding linens - you're only allowed to have 4 towels a day, we will only change your sheets every 2 days, you can only have 1 pool towel each for your entire stay, etc. Right off the bat, we felt like we were a burden to the hotel, not guests. The woman at the front desk acted like she would rather be ANYWHERE else but there. We were checked in without any problems, thankfully, and headed up to the room. The appearance of the room was fine for a super 8, and it smelled clean, but the room was FREEZING cold. We checked the temperature setting - the A/C was on the lowest it could possibly be, but it still felt like the arctic. As we were getting in to bed that night, we noticed that the bottom sheet on the bed was a flat sheet (not fitted) - this is fairly common in hotels I've stayed at, however the sheet was too short to be tucked in, it wasjust hanging loosely on the bottom. When we woke up in the morning, it was to a bare matress. The bottom sheet had bunched up in the middle of the bed. Additionally, the bedspread was made of a very slippery fabric, and that had ended up sliding on the floor during the night. With the freezing temperature and no top blanket, we were pretty miserable. Not to mention that the mattress sagged a little in the middle, so my husband and I were smushed up against eachother. The shower was fine and we headed out for the day. We returned that night, ready to shower, to find that the maids had taken our used towels, but had not replaced them with fresh ones. We had no towels. We called the front desk to have them bring some up, explaining that they had been forgotten. The woman at the desk told us we would have to come down and get some ourselves, because she could not leave her desk (even though we had already seen her out back smoking a few times - apparently it's okay to leave the desk for that). One of the primary reasons we selected this hotel was that we were told it offered free wireless internet. I set up my laptop and was directed to a log on page for the free internet - I just needed an access code. I called the front desk to find out what it was, but was informed that the internet was disabled at night -- ?!?!?!? I was VERY disappointed about this - I had work to take care of and could not do it because I couldn't use the internet after 10, and it wouldnt' be available until 7. We were gone during the day, as many people who stay at a super 8 would be (it's not some luxury resort where you feel comfortable lounging in your room during the day), so we were unable to get any use out of the "free internet." I would never return to this super 8 again, and do NOT recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag, check your room upon arrival!”
Reviews.Author: MnSensei
Reviews.Content: When I arrived on Wednesday aroung 5 pm and went to my room I flipped on the light switch, nothing. I flipped on another one, nothing. I thought maybe the power was out, but no, it turned out that the two main lights were burned out. I went to the desk but they told me they didn't have anyone to change the bulbs. I offered to do it if they gave them to me, but they said they couldn't do that either. They offered to move me to a room with working lights, which I accepted. Upon moving all my stuff down the hall to the new room I realized that room did not have the microwave or refrigerator that the previous one had, and which I had requested. On the plus side most of the staff was friendly, the free wireless is great and there is an adequate tv selection, nice pool and good parking. I had a couple other issues though. My room wasn't cleaned until between 4pm and 5 pm daily even though I was out of it by 9 am, and when I didn't get plastic cups or an ice bucket I couldn't find a maid who could speak enough english to understand what I was missing. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Super 8 Indianapolis College Park....Disgusting Experience”
Reviews.Author: DebraLynn
Reviews.Content: I am a grandmother who arrived @ the hotel @ 9:45 pm with my daughter and 8 year old granddaughter. The room appeared clean. We had to leave early in the morning and I asked my granddaughter to check around the bed for hair ties, socks, etc. as we were packing. She held up a used condom that we had her drop on the floor and rushed her to the bathroom to disinfect her hands. We went immediately to the front desk and the manager asked us to show him the item! He left for 20 minutes to go to the room to see it and came back and asked us who we had in the room! Then he says there is nothing he could do and turned his back on us. I told him his room was not cleaned properly and my granddaughter was put in a health risk situation. He retorted that he had "professional cleaners". Do not stay here if you have children. Not only would I not stay here again, I will avoid Super 8 in our future travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Service / Room Levels Declining”
Reviews.Author: TrentinChicago
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property several times when it was the Fairfield , always had a great experience, rooms were clean and the staff was helpful. On my first visit since this property is now Super 8, rooms were not as clean as in the past and there was less attention to detail. The rooms are starting to look dated and matresses need to be replaced. The staff was not as nice nor did they seem as polished as the staff when this was a Fairfield. I think the staff may still be adjusting to the new brand and their processes. Rates for the property were still very reasonable (around $50 a night) and the location is near several good restaurants with easy access to I-465. In an area where there are numerous economy lodging options (Microtel, Drury, Comfort etc.) I would not recommend the Super 8.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: WeegeNC
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easy to reach from I-465 and the immediate vicinity seemed safe to me. There were a few restaurants and shops located nearby. The room was small, but at least it was clean. The staff at the front desk were very polite and friendly. I would consider staying here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Super 8 Indianapolis College Park
HotelInfo.Address: 9251 Wesleyan Road, Indianapolis, IN 46268 (Formerly Fairfield Inn College Park)
